alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Red River (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 6:49AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Sevier, central McCurtain, northern Franklin and central Red River Counties through 730 AM CST... At 649 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Broken Bow to near Idabel to near Hagansport. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Hagansport, Boxelder, Idabel, Broken Bow, Bogata, Avery, Annona, Haworth, Garvin, Eagletown, Hochatown, Harris, Cuthand, Goodwater, English, Holly Creek, Glover, Johntown and Oak Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
